page.title: 04HARTSHEAD FIELD CENTRE(CONT)
page.content: The River Tame and the Huddersfield Narrow Canal provide a rich resource of primary historical material as well as a wet habitat. There is a varied selection of{flora and fauna}including plants such as the Himalayan Balsam which was spread along the canal routes after being introduced from Asia in the 19th century.Scrub,water and woodland birds(especially the jay) are present in the reserve.There is a great variety of woodland ,aquatic and moorland flora.Heather is present in pockets down by the river and on the hills. The classrooms of the centre are closed (1985) while{asbestos}is removed from the C.E.G.B. buildings prior to demolition.
